abstract: A partial (Formula presented.)-spread in (Formula presented.) is a collection of (Formula presented.)-dimensional subspaces with trivial intersection. So far, the maximum size of a partial (Formula presented.)-spread in (Formula presented.) was known for the cases (Formula presented.), (Formula presented.), and (Formula presented.) with the additional requirements (Formula presented.) and (Formula presented.). We completely resolve the case (Formula presented.) for the binary case (Formula presented.).
